intro: Hieracium schoenbrunnense, commonly known as the Schönbrunn hawkweed, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and is native to Central Europe. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. It has hairy stems and leaves that are often arranged in a rosette pattern. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
